metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13710 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in downloads in Google Chromeprior to 78.0.3904.70 allowed a remote attacker to bypass downloadrestrictions via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
